result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $486.52 to be converted to a civil judgment in favor of Walmart.
Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No contact with any stores listed in the criminal complaint or read in list.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
DNA previously done.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office

Defendant Tammy L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Case 15CM2439 dismissed and read in, along with the read in list provided.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Sentence of:
6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days ) Concurrent to any other sentence. 
3 Years of Initial Confinement
3 Years of Extended Supervision
Conditions of extended supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with any stores listed in the criminal complaint or read in list. 
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Restitution: $486.52 be converted to a civil judgment in favor of Walmart. 
COSTS:  $268.00to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA previously done. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Tammy L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tammy L Scott
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2016)
Prior: 2018 S Grand Ave, Waukesha, WI 53189

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart STore. Defendant allowed non collect phone calls.

Defendant Tammy L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
